snippet: After days of talks, Greek political leaders reached a deal Thursday to support a package of harsh austerity measures demanded by Greece’s financial backers in return for a bailout.
abstract: Global financial markets receive a reprieve after Greek political leaders agree to sweeping new austerity measures that should unlock the financing Greece needs to avert a potentially damaging default in March; European finance ministers delay approval of the deal, saying they want more than $400 million of additional cuts in 2012, but they are expected to endorse it, as is the Greek Parliament, despite grumblings.

byline.contributor: Stephen Castle contributed reporting from Brussels and Nicholas Kulish from Berlin.

lead_paragraph: After days of talks, Greek political leaders reached a deal Thursday to support a package of harsh austerity measures demanded by Greece’s financial backers in return for a bailout.

headline.main: Greeks Reach Deal on Austerity to Meet Condition of Bailout
headline.print_headline: Greece Signs Off on Sweeping Cuts to Calm Lenders
